title: Add HTML report generation for security scan results
description:
## Overview
Generate rich, interactive HTML reports for security scan results similar to Qodo-Cover's test_results.html.

## Features
- Severity distribution pie chart (CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW)
- OWASP Top 10 breakdown with visual indicators
- Filterable/sortable table of findings
- Timeline of security improvements over scans
- Shareable static HTML file for stakeholders
- Export to PDF option

## Technical Approach
- New module: `rec_praxis_rlm/reporters.py`
- Use Jinja2 templates for HTML generation
- Chart.js for interactive visualizations
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Include inline CSS/JS for standalone files

## Value
Security managers can share reports with non-technical stakeholders without requiring technical tools.

## Priority
P0 - Quick win, high visual impact

## Estimated Effort
2-3 days

title: v0.9.0: Multi-language support (JS/TS, Go, Rust)
HIGH: Fix file write race conditions
description: Multi-process writes can overwrite, use fcntl.flock()

title: Fix test generation CLI initialization failure
description: DX evaluation found critical bug: rec-praxis-generate-tests fails with 'coverage package is required' error despite coverage being installed. CLI wrapper has initialization issue in cli_generate_tests() function.

title: HIGH: Add FactStore connection cleanup
description: Add __del__ to close connections if close() not called

title: Add observation compression module
description: Compress experiences to ~500 tokens using LLM (from claude-mem analysis). Reduces recall token cost by 80-90%. Enable 20 experiences instead of 6 in same token budget.

title: Build web UI for memory viewer
description: Visualize experiences timeline, search/filter interface, concept tag cloud, file reference graph. Improve debugging and exploration.

title: CRITICAL: Add NaN/Inf validation to cosine similarity
description: Validate embeddings don't contain NaN or Inf values before cosine similarity calculation to prevent error propagation (EDGE-CASE-ANALYSIS.md #1.1)

title: Research claude-mem integration patterns
description: Analyze claude-mem's observation compression, progressive disclosure, and hook integration for potential adoption in rec-praxis-rlm

title: Add Claude Code hook integration
description: Create .claude/settings.json hooks for automatic capture. post_tool_use captures experiences, session_start injects context. Zero user intervention.

title: v0.8.0: Hypothesis property-based testing
HIGH: Enable SQLite WAL mode
description: Enable WAL mode for better concurrency in FactStore

title: Implement Endless Mode for agents
description: Automatic compression pipeline, token budget tracking, long-running agent support. Enable 100+ step agents without context exhaustion.

title: CRITICAL: Add type validation to FactStore.extract_facts
description: None/non-string input crashes, add isinstance check

title: CRITICAL: Validate empty regex patterns in grep
description: Empty pattern matches everywhere, add validation to reject empty/whitespace patterns

title: Improve LLM mode discoverability in CLI output
description: When template mode finds no issues, add hint suggesting --use-llm for deeper analysis. Improves UX for detecting hardcoded credentials and SQL injection vulnerabilities.

title: Enhance MLflow integration with security dashboards
description:
## Overview
Enhance existing MLflow integration to track security posture over time, similar to Qodo-Cover's W&B integration.

## Features to Add
- Security posture dashboard showing trends
- Finding trends over time (are we improving?)
- False positive rate tracking
- A/B test different LLM prompts for review quality
- Team performance metrics (which developer writes most secure code?)
- Cost tracking (LLM API usage per scan)

## Metrics to Track
- Total findings per scan (trend line)
- Findings by severity (stacked area chart)
- OWASP category distribution over time
- Time to remediate issues (MTTR)
- Re-introduced vulnerabilities (regression rate)
- Coverage: % of codebase scanned

## Dashboard Views
1. **Executive Dashboard**: High-level security posture
2. **Developer Dashboard**: Personal security metrics
3. **Experiment Dashboard**: A/B test prompt variations
4. **Cost Dashboard**: API usage and optimization

## Technical Approach
- Extend `rec_praxis_rlm/telemetry.py`
- Add custom MLflow metrics
- Create dashboard templates
- Store baseline metrics in procedural memory

## Value
Data-driven security improvements, demonstrate ROI

## Priority
P2 - Enhancement to existing feature

## Estimated Effort
1 week

## Dependencies
- MLflow already integrated

title: Add PR-Agent style GitHub integration with inline comments
HIGH: Add FAISS memory limit 500MB
description: Prevent OOM with 500MB limit and fallback to linear scan

title: v0.7.0: Branch coverage analysis and conditional test generation
description:
## Overview
Analyze branch coverage (not just line coverage) and generate tests targeting uncovered branches.

## Features
- Parse coverage.py branch coverage data
- Identify uncovered if/else, try/except, match/case branches
- Generate tests targeting specific branches
- Visualize branch coverage gaps in reports
- CFG (Control Flow Graph) analysis for complex conditionals

## Technical Approach
- Use coverage.py branch analysis API
- AST traversal to identify conditional statements
- Generate test inputs that trigger specific branches
- Use SMT solver (Z3) for constraint solving (optional)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Parses branch coverage from .coverage file
- Identifies uncovered branches with line numbers
- Generates tests targeting specific branches
- Branch coverage increase >10% per test

## Dependencies
- Depends on: rec-praxis-rlm-nsy (v0.6.0)

## Estimated Effort
3-4 days

title: CRITICAL: Fix FAISS dimension mismatch crash
description: Mixing different embedding dimensions crashes, validate consistency

title: Add concept tagging and extraction
description: Auto-extract semantic tags from goal/action/result using LLM. Enable rich semantic search (show all database-related experiences). Extract file references automatically.

title: Add privacy tagging system
description: Extend Experience with privacy_level field (public/private/pii). Auto-redact sensitive data before storage. Prevent accidental secret leakage.

title: CRITICAL: Escape SQL LIKE wildcards in FactStore
description: Attackers can brute-force using % wildcards, add ESCAPE clause

title: Update SARIF formatter version to 0.9.0
description: SARIF output shows hardcoded version 0.4.3 instead of current 0.9.0. Should use dynamic import from rec_praxis_rlm.__version__

title: CRITICAL: Validate storage paths prevent traversal
description: Path traversal allows writing outside allowed directory

title: CRITICAL: Add checksums to storage format v2.0
description: Silent corruption not detected, add SHA-256 checksums

title: HIGH: Fix FAISS index desync
description: Persist to storage first to prevent index desync

title: Dogfood test generation on v0.9.0 codebase
description: Run rec-praxis-generate-tests on the new test_generation.py code to validate it works end-to-end

title: Implement progressive disclosure API
description: Add recall_layer1 (compressed), recall_layer2 (full), recall_layer3 (related context). User-controlled token budget expansion.

title: HIGH: Add regex timeout for ReDoS
description: Catastrophic backtracking hangs, add 5s timeout

title: v0.6.0: DSPy LLM-based test generation with assertions
description:
## Overview
Upgrade test generation from template-based stubs to intelligent LLM-based generation with actual assertions.

## Features
- DSPy-based test generation using Groq/OpenAI
- Generate actual test assertions (not just TODO stubs)
- Analyze function signatures and docstrings for test inputs
- Generate edge cases and boundary conditions
- Use procedural memory to learn from successful test patterns
- Support for parameterized tests (@pytest.mark.parametrize)

## Technical Approach
- Create DSPy Signature for test generation
- Input: function source code, coverage gaps, similar test patterns
- Output: complete pytest test with assertions
- Use ChainOfThought for reasoning about test cases
- Store successful test patterns in procedural memory

## Acceptance Criteria
- Generated tests have real assertions (no TODO/pass)
- Tests cover happy path + edge cases + error cases
- Tests execute and pass
- Quality score: >90% test usefulness (manual review)

## Estimated Effort
2-3 days

comments.author: speed
comments.text: Started v0.6.0 - added DSPy signature foundation. Need to complete LM integration in __init__ and _generate_test_code. Est remaining: 4-6 hours.

title: CRITICAL: Track corruption statistics
description: Corrupted lines skipped silently, track and report to user

title: Implement test generation agent inspired by Qodo-Cover
description:
## Overview
Build TestGenerationAgent that analyzes source code and generates pytest tests targeting uncovered code paths, similar to Qodo-Cover's core functionality.

## Features
- Analyze Python source files and coverage reports
- Generate pytest tests targeting uncovered paths
- Use procedural memory to learn from past test patterns
- Validate generated tests actually run and pass
- Support multiple coverage formats (Cobertura, coverage.py)
- Iterative improvement until coverage target met

## Technical Approach
- New agent: `rec_praxis_rlm/agents/test_generation.py`
- Integration with coverage.py and pytest-cov
- DSPy-based test generation prompts
- Memory stores successful test patterns
- Validate tests before committing to memory

## CLI Interface
```bash
rec-praxis-generate-tests src/app.py \
  --coverage-report .coverage \
  --target-coverage 90 \
  --max-iterations 5
```

## Value
Close the loop - not just find security issues, but generate tests to prevent regression.

## Priority
P1 - High strategic value, differentiator

## Estimated Effort
1-2 weeks

## Dependencies
- pytest-cov
- coverage.py

comments.author: speed
comments.text: Implementation analysis complete. Agent structure identified - similar to CodeReviewAgent pattern. Key components needed: coverage analyzer, AST parser, DSPy-based test generator, test validator, iterative loop. This is a 1-2 week effort. Recommend phased approach: P1=basic generation, P2=iterative mode. Unclaiming for now - will revisit when time permits for substantial feature work.

comments.author: speed
comments.text:
IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (1-2 weeks):

Phase 1: Coverage Analysis (2-3 days)
- Parse coverage.py .coverage file
- Identify uncovered lines/branches/functions
- Calculate coverage percentage
- Generate coverage gap report

Phase 2: Test Generation Core (3-4 days)
- Create TestGenerationAgent class
- DSPy-based test generation prompts
- Target uncovered code paths
- Generate pytest functions with fixtures
- Use procedural memory for patterns

Phase 3: Test Validation (2-3 days)
- Execute generated tests with pytest
- Verify tests pass and increase coverage
- Store successful patterns in memory
- Reject/retry failing tests

Phase 4: Iterative Improvement (1-2 days)
- Integration with iterative mode (v78)
- Multi-iteration until target met
- MLflow integration

Phase 5: CLI & Docs (1-2 days)
- rec-praxis-generate-tests command
- README documentation
- GitHub Actions examples

Dependencies: pytest>=7.4, pytest-cov>=4.1, coverage>=7.0

DECISION: Defer to dedicated sprint. All quick wins complete (5/6 = 83%).

title: Edge case analysis and robustness improvements
description: Comprehensive analysis of null/empty inputs, boundaries, concurrency, errors, performance limits, and security vulnerabilities

title: Add iterative improvement mode for autonomous security fixes
description:
## Overview
Implement coverage-driven iterative mode similar to Qodo-Cover's --max-iterations, but for security quality instead of test coverage.

## Features
- Run multiple LLM iterations until quality score target met
- Each iteration learns from previous failures
- Auto-suggest fixes for detected issues
- Re-scan with fixes applied to validate improvement
- Track quality score progression
- Stop when target reached or max iterations hit

## CLI Interface
```bash
rec-praxis-review src/app.py \
  --mode iterative \
  --max-iterations 5 \
  --target-score 95 \
  --auto-fix true
```

## How It Works
1. First pass: Find security issues (baseline score: 60)
2. Agent suggests fixes using procedural memory
3. Apply fixes to code (or suggest to user)
4. Re-scan with fixes applied (new score: 75)
5. Iterate until quality score >= 95% or max iterations

## Quality Score Calculation
- Weighted by severity (CRITICAL: 10pts, HIGH: 5pts, etc.)
- Penalize high-risk patterns
- Reward secure coding patterns
- Track improvement over time

## Value
Autonomous security improvement, not just detection. "Set it and forget it" security.

## Priority
P1 - Differentiator from static tools

## Estimated Effort
1 week

## Dependencies
- Requires test generation agent (rec-praxis-rlm-r7o)

title: HIGH: Fix file descriptor leaks
description: Use context managers for temp files to prevent leaks

title: Add GitHub badges and community features to README
description:
## Overview
Enhance README with GitHub badges, community links, and branding similar to Qodo AI repositories.

## Badges to Add
- PyPI version and downloads (monthly)
- Python version support
- Test coverage percentage
- Build status (GitHub Actions)
- License
- Discord/Slack community
- Security score badge (custom)

## Community Features
- Discord server for discussions
- Twitter/X account for updates
- Contributing guidelines badge
- Code of Conduct badge
- Sponsor/funding links

## Example Implementation
```markdown
[![PyPI Downloads](https://pepy.tech/badge/rec-praxis-rlm/month)](https://pepy.tech/project/rec-praxis-rlm)
[![Discord](https://img.shields.io/discord/YOUR_SERVER_ID)](https://discord.gg/...)
[![Security Score](https://img.shields.io/badge/security-A+-brightgreen)](...)
```

## Custom Badge: Security Score
Create https://rec-praxis.dev/badge/{org}/{repo} endpoint that:
- Scans repository with rec-praxis-rlm
- Generates letter grade (A+, A, B, C, D, F)
- Returns shields.io compatible badge JSON

## Value
- Build community around project
- Increase adoption and visibility
- Professional appearance

## Priority
P0 - Quick win, trivial to implement

## Estimated Effort
2-3 hours

title: Add experience type classification
description: Auto-classify experiences: learn, recover, optimize, explore. Enable type-based filtering for better recall relevance.
